title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
subhed: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: Iran's regime faces combined pressure from street protests, Israel and US
French judges alarmed by rumors of potential US sanctions
byline: By Grégoire Biseau (Bordeaux) and Franck Johannès

title: In Gaza, the war is creating a new generation of deaf children
subhed: According to a survey by a local non-profit organization, 35,000 children and adults have partially or completely lost their hearing during the two years of war that followed the Hamas attack in October 2023.

title: US immigration officer kills woman in Minneapolis
subhed: An officer shot and killed a woman whom US officials accused of trying to run over ICE agents with her vehicle. The city's mayor has called that claim 'bullshit' and demanded that federal immigration agents leave the city.

title: Semyon Bychkov appointed music director of the Opéra national de Paris
subhed: The American-naturalized conductor, aged 73, is succeeding Gustavo Dudamel, who resigned in May 2023.

title: Gaza's grandparents, shattered pillars of a traumatized society
subhed: Elderly people, whose health is often fragile and mobility reduced, feel as if they are reliving the tragedy of the Nakba, the forced exodus of Palestinians during the creation of Israel in 1948.

title: US will control Venezuelan oil sales 'indefinitely,' energy secretary says
'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
Maduro Kidnapping: 'There is a tragic irony in seeing Donald Trump cast himself as Venezuela's liberator'
Trump plots offer to buy Greenland as NATO ally Denmark seethes

title: Greenland: Europe rejects US threats over sovereignty but finds options limited

title: Brigitte Bardot buried in Saint-Tropez as cause of death revealed
French writer sued by family members over novel allegedly depicting them as Nazi collaborators
Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhed: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhed: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhed: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
'A spirit of reconquest has taken hold in Washington, particularly driven by Secretary of State Marco Rubio'
